revised_title: Investigation of Viscous Flow in Metals and its Relation to Stress
tldr: The author conducted experiments on the viscous flow in metals, particularly lead and fuse wire, under varying loads and temperatures. They discovered that the rate of extension for a given load becomes constant over time if the stress is kept constant. The author proposed a formula to represent the relationship between length, time, and stress in the viscous flow of metals, and found that this formula accurately represents the observed data.
